gpcm.exppoly module¶

class gpcm.exppoly.ExpPoly[source]¶

Bases: object

A constant multiplied by an exponentiated polynomial.

Parameters

  • const (tensor, optional) – Constant.

  • poly (exppoly.Poly) – Polynomial.

eval(**var_map)[source]¶

Evaluate the exponentiated polynomial.

Parameters

**var_map (tensor) – Variable mapping.

Returns

Evaluated exponentiated polynomial.

Return type

tensor

integrate(*names, **var_map)[source]¶

Integrate over a subset of the variables from \(-\infty\) to \(\infty\) and evaluate the result.

Parameters

  • *names (str) – Variable names.

  • **var_map (tensor) – Variable mapping.

Returns

Result.

Return type

tensor

integrate_box(*name_and_lims, **var_map)[source]¶

Integrate over a subset of the variables from some lower limit to some upper limit and evaluate the result. Infinity can be specified using np.inf. Any infinite lower limit corresponds to negative infinity, and any infinite upper limit corresponds to positive infinity.

Parameters

  • *name_and_lims (tuple) – Three-tuples containing the variable names, lower limits, and upper limits.

  • **var_map (tensor) – Variable mapping.

Returns

Result.

Return type

tensor

integrate_half(*names, **var_map)[source]¶

Integrate over a subset of the variables from \(-\infty\) to \(0\) and evaluate the result.

Parameters

  • *names (str) – Variable names.

  • **var_map (tensor) – Variable mapping.

Returns

Result.

Return type

tensor

substitute[source]¶

Substitute a polynomial for a variable.

Parameters

  • name (str) – Name of variable.

  • poly (exppoly.Poly) – Polynomial to substitute for variable.

Returns

Result of substitution.

Return type

exppoly.ExpPoly

translate_var[source]¶

Translate a variable by some polynomial; that is, substitute a variable for itself plus some polynomial.

Parameters

  • name (str) – Name of variable.

  • poly (exppoly.Poly) – Polynomial to shift by.

Returns

Resulting exponentiated polynomial.

Return type

exppoly.ExpPoly

Parameters

Returns

Return type

exppoly.Poly

gpcm.exppoly.var(x, power=1)[source]¶

Polynomial consisting of just a single variable.

Parameters

  • x (tensor) – Constant.

  • power (int, optional) – Power. Defaults to one.

Returns

Resulting polynomial.

Return type

exppoly.Poly
